review: A simple Wolfenstein like FPS game you can knock out in less than an hour. The art style is fantasic, the music a little bit mid, the animations are great and bosses spectacular. The only real negative things I can say is that the game is way to easy  (I beat the entire game with 0 deaths) and that it's just a tad bit short; it needs an extra episode to make the whole experience complete. Overall 7.5/10 the triangle is covered in my coom :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198073750945', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1704645711}
review:
Esencia Nuclear Throne en un FPS clÃ¡sico. Si te mola Nuclear Throne supongo que te llamarÃ¡ un mÃ­nimo este juego. Y al ser gratis, pues eso que te llevas.

Buen diseÃ±o de enemigos y escenarios.

Buen rap venusiano de BSO (disponible para comprarla en Bandcamp). "Welcome To The Crib" me flipa xD.

Tienes tres misiones por zona, una de ellas siendo el boss de la misma. AdemÃ¡s, tres niveles secretos en total, dependiendo de los triÃ¡ngulos que vayas consiguiendo. EstÃ¡n interesantes, asÃ­ que recomiendo encontrarlos para llegar a jugar a estos niveles. Y ojito, que hay algÃºn que otro pasadizo secreto tapado por paredes falsas que te lleva a otros triÃ¡ngulos secretos, necesarios para completar el juego al 100%.

SÃ³lo puedes mover la cÃ¡mara horizontalmente, estilo Wolfenstein 3D o Doom clÃ¡sico.
Al disparar no puedes mover la cÃ¡mara (intuyo que es un fallo?). Hay una guÃ­a que te dice quÃ© tienes que hacer para arreglarlo, porque para disparar (en especial la ametralladora) fastidia bastante.

Le faltan opciones para cambiar la sensibilidad de cÃ¡mara, etc. No se por quÃ© la mayorÃ­a de juegos gratuitos que he jugado no tienen opciones de este tipo... En fin xD.

En resumen: para ser gratis tiene buen contenido, secretos por descubrir, buena BSO y, en general, esa esencia Nuclear Throne tan caracterÃ­stica.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972728940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1704500745}
review:
Behold the lamentable tapestry woven by the ill-fated foray into the digital realm known as "Gun Godz." My initial foray into this pixelated abyss is marked by a bemused incredulity, for who amongst the denizens of the gaming cosmos elevates this decrepit offering with the sanctity of an upvote? Verily, it is a conundrum that defies the cognitive faculties of discerning minds.

In the annals of first-person shooter antiquity, "Gun Godz" descends with an ominous weight, an ersatz relic aspiring to invoke nostalgia but, alas, merely echoing the discordant cacophony of inferior predecessors. The game unfurls as a sprawling panorama of dissonance, where the auditory realm, bedecked in cacophonous disarray, births a lamentation upon the senses. Music, an auditory aberration that would make the muses weep, intertwines with sound effects of egregious quality, rending the auditory experience asunder. A sonic dissonance that shatters the illusion of immersion, leaving naught but the debris of auditory disappointment.

The coup de grÃ¢ce, a manifestation of incompetence unforgivable, resides within the lamentable animations that beset the arsenal of firearms. Behold the puppetry of calamity, a waltz of inadequacy where the ballet of bullets is marred by a choreography that befits only the nescient. A visual cacophony unfolds as firearms, mere avatars of lethality, traverse a realm of animation so discordant that one is compelled to question the very essence of their digital existence.

Yet, within this digital hellscape, a lone commendation surfaces like a fragile bloom in the ashen landscape â€“ the game's nominal redemption lies in its state of gratuitous freedom, a facet that tethers it to the realms of "free." Alas, in the shadow of such meager commendation, the game languishes, bereft of substance, its very essence eclipsed by the darkness of its inadequacy.

In conclusion, "Gun Godz" stands as a testament to the pitfalls of expectation, a mirage of potential obliterated upon the jagged rocks of its own ineptitude. A narrative of woe, where the symphony of disappointment echoes through the corridors of its ill-fated digital dominion. This indictment is not a mere criticism; it is a requiem for a game that, in its paltry existence, shrouds itself in the ignominy of mediocrity. Let it be known that even the most forgiving of souls cannot elevate this digital phantom to a status beyond the abysmal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990262556', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1698871152}
review:
Very brief and fast old-school FPS in the vein of Wolfenstein 3D!

The level design is maze-like here too, but even the levels are so brief and fast that it's still a pleasure to go through them! Probably also thanks to the fact that there are no secrets or anything like that, so your only goal is to go in guns blazing, blowing everyone up as if you were Arnold Schwarzenegger or something! 
The weapons and enemies are all quite basic and it's good as it is, I don't think that the point was to be innovative here, instead, just to create something fun to play and it really is! 
The controls aren't the smoothest I've ever seen (mouse aim is proper Wolf3D type old-school), but yeah, you wouldn't expect them to be on a game that takes so much of an influence from Wolf3D... it gets to the point where it's just a gameplay mechanic. 
The gunplay feels great, the 8-bit hip hop soundtrack fits the theme and the art style and concept are also cool!

I've been wanting to play this for quite some time but it seemed like I couldn't download it...? Maybe it was kept in the store for long before finally actually releasing it? Something like that.
Anyhoo, it's a lot of fun and you can easily beat it in one playthrough like it's nothing. And it's free!! 
I really liked Vlambeer's style, so it was great to finally be able to play this too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198113848693', 'num_games_owned': 1170, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1696602634}
review:
[h1]Comentario AnalÃ­tico: "GUN GODZ"[/h1]

GUN GODZ es un spin-off gratuito de Nuclear Throne publicado y desarrollado por Vlambeer en 2012 (Y publicado en Steam en 2019), se trata de un retro-shooter en primera persona reminiscente a los clÃ¡sicos de estilo Doom.

Es simple y corto, menos de una hora de duraciÃ³n incluyendo los niveles extra, sin embargo es efectivo en entretener y ofrecer un ligero desafÃ­o con picos de intensidad.

Es importante destacar que este juego lleva desde el 2012 disponible en Itch.io, pero esta versiÃ³n de Steam cuenta con varias diferencias y mejoras, como los nuevos efectos de sonido, la posibilidad de remapear controles o la implementaciÃ³n de los logros de Steam.

Hay mucha gente quejÃ¡ndose de este port para Steam, diciendo que la versiÃ³n de Itch.io es mejor y que la de Steam estÃ¡ repleta de bugs. Personalmente esta versiÃ³n me funcionÃ³ perfecto, ningÃºn error ni nada por el estilo, asÃ­ que quizÃ¡ fueron resueltos con el paso de los aÃ±os o se trata de errores muy puntuales.

[b]Â¿En conclusiÃ³n?[/b] GUN GODZ estÃ¡ entretenido.

review: It's a fun little Wolfenstein clone with a good soundtrack that'll last you about half an hour if you just go through the levels without searching for the secrets or going achievement hunting. I found that the aiming bug actually made the game more challenging and fun. However, the steam version also seems to suffer from a bug where it doesn't save the player's progress correctly. For this one reason, I cannot recommend the steam version of the game. Get the game off-steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561199095440259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1708305914}
review:
Acabo de completar el juego al 100% y la verdad es que me gusto bastante para lo corto que es. el gameplay puede ser rapido y violento o un poco mas calmado en algunos niveles, hablando de eso, los niveles estan bien, a veces puede que te confundan un poco pero es cuestion de prestar un poco de atencion y ver que el pasillo al que estas yendo es por donde viniste. las armas estan bien, desde la pistola hasta el lanzacohetes aunque mi favorita es la escopeta que hace bastante daÃ±o de cerca. otra cosa es el soundtrack y a mi parecer es decente, es decir, esta. y es bueno pero me gusta que sea mas ambiente que musica como tal mas que nada en un juego asi.

sobre todo 8/10, demasiado corto pero muy divertido

author: {'steamid': '76561198077115961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1684040188}
review:
Enemies will often shoot you around corners or through solid objects after you've left their view, while the very bare minimum amount of terrain in your way will obstruct your shots.
The enemy ai will, without hesitation, shoot you within frames of appearing, so this compounds the prior issues that are not fixed by knowledge of the levels.
No sensitivity options means the fast pace cannot match what you're used to with turning, Clicking the controls setting will only prompt you, automatically, to set the movement controls and the melee key.
It needs a lot of work.

review:
"Traer el Arcade de 1937 al 2020" Si, ponele. 

Esa era la propuesta de los juegos del ahora separado dÃºo legendario de Vlambeer. Con este en especial mandaron de una patada el Wolfenstein del '92 a este siglo con arte fresco de Paul Veer, una banda sonora de Jukio Kallio bien acople a la jugabilidad de ritmo rÃ¡pido y sarpando el tema principal junto a Doseone.

Es corto pero me sumÃ³ varias horas mÃ¡s el completar los desafÃ­os de cada nivel y tener los logros al 100% (postearon una soluciÃ³n para llegar a eso). Rap, aliens gangsters, secuaces sanguijuelas (no, no son ositos, ya me di cuenta) y una primera apariciÃ³n de un todopoderoso Yung Venuz aportan lo suyo al genero del clÃ¡sico shooter sin costo alguno.

review:
un FPS estilo retro, corto, pero muy bueno, basicamente hay pocas armas, vas consiguiendo balas y matas a todos para meterte en una especie de cuarto y asi pasar de nivel, cada nivel restartea armas y municiones.

Decente variedad de enemigos, duracion de 30-40 minutos. Dificultad interesante, tiene logros.

Realmente es genial, 12 niveles y 4 secretos, tiene mele.

7/10

review:
If you can get used to the frankly insanely high sensitivity then you're in for a pretty fun time. It's short, fast-paced, and has some sick tunes. Good time all around.

Edit: Apparently the Steam port of this game sucks, especially with the holding down shoot preventing you from looking around which negatively impacts the minigun which somehow I just thought was intentional. So if you're interested in playing this game then it's probably best to download it from them on the web. Where is it? I do y know go find out yourselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997934524', 'num_games_owned': 3413, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1644900710}
review: A fun, quirky [i]Wolfenstein 3D[/i] clone with a unique theme, fun characters, and good weapons. I can't say definitively if this is the [i]only[/i] FPS on steam about Venusian Gangsta Rap, but it's definitely one of the few. My only real complaint is that the mouse sensitivity feels somewhat choppy and apparantly there's a mod you can do to fix this, but it was never a big enough problem for me to bother looking into. The weapons feel really satisfying and punchy and the levels are much more compact than [i]Wolf 3D[/i]'s levels always felt a little [i]too[/i]. A good bite-sized blast of retro-styled first-person shooting that you can finish in about 45 minutes and since you can earn "triangles" to unlock bonus levels based on your time and whether or not you got 100% Kills and item pickups there is some replay value. I imagine I'll be playing this a bit more as the one bonus level I did unlock was pretty clever and I want to see the rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1637989947}
review:
GUN GODZ is a 3D Raycasting FPS game (aka: Wolfenstein 3D ripoff) that's been slapped together with the godawful GameMaker Studio video game construction kit from Yoyogames.  That's right, instead of just taking the godawful Raycasting Game Maker construction kit to churn out this template flip, they went through all the hard work of finding a tutorial/template for doing the same thing in GameMaker Studio.   The game has a sci-fi/organised crime theme as you break out of a space prison on Venus or something, and kill off Fozzie Bear's family of muppet bears.  It's hard to tell because of the bad graphics. 

The most surprising revelation from my review of this game is that GameMaker Studio is capable of far better quality Wolf3D ripoffs than Raycasting Game Maker... which is a video game construction kit that only has [i]one job[/i].  And it failed.  A lot of work seems to have gone into filling out the video game template for doing a Wolf3D ripoff in GameMaker Studio here, and it does show.  GUN GODZ is surprisingly playable on a modern Windows PC, despite ripping off a game that was released in 1992.  And there's the real problem.

Visually this looks similar to, if not worse than games from 1992.  The art is blocky, chunky, "pixel" style, similar to Wolf3D, but iD/Apogee had the excuse that computers back then simply weren't capable of any better.  Viambeer has no similar excuse... either this was made to look bad on purpose, or Viambeer simply wasn't capable of better graphics... either way, that's no acceptable justification for the bad visuals, which alone is enough to disqualify this game from any recommendation.

On a technical basis, poor visuals aside, resolution and controls are locked, which pushes this below basic, minimum standards for a modern PC game.

The game is completely free, however.  Nothing speaks more to a developers belief in themselves and their product than making their game available for everyone without remuneration. This is certainly a gesture that shows dedication to the gaming industry. It's a shame in this case that the implementation is below the minimum standards a dedicated PC game should offer to enthusiasts. There's no "maybe" option in Steam, unfortunately, but I hope to see more work from this developer, perhaps as part of a professional game development company that can make full use of their talents without needing to make budget/quality compromises like pixel art and using off the shelf game templates and construction kits.

review: eh, its free to play. I think the main strength of vlambeers' games is that they are simple to learn, hard to master, and this is no different; its literally a time trial version of a retro FPS like Doom or Wolfenstein (literally, theres no jumping or vertical mouse movement.) So if this sounds good to you, consider picking it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047413192', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1630389725}
review:
First of all, there's a mod in the discussions page that fixes almost all the problems with this game. Download it and this next section is more of less moot. This game is unacceptably broken, even for a free game.

The game is incredibly frustrating since you can't turn while shooting, making it incredibly hard to aim, especially when you're getting knocked back. This makes trying to get the achievements almost impossible. But don't worry, it IS actually impossible to get all the achievements because the achievement for getting 52 triangles (basically completion points) is broken and apparently requires 53, which is impossible. But this is nothing compared to melee. When you're meleeing if you move your mouse even slightly you start spinning at such speeds that it's impossible to know what you're looking at, much less hit anything. It's not just during mouse movement either, for some reason it retains the momentum so trying to melee is usually to your own detriment as it's incredibly disorienting. (This one isn't fixed yet, but the modder said he could do it)
Also sometimes shots seem to miss point blank as sometimes enemies that dies to single shotgun blasts tanked several hits from point blank.

I was having fun before, but trying the challenges made just how broken the mechanics are VERY clear. Like someone else said, the minigun is nigh unusable because you can't adjust your aim and if you get knocked back even slightly good luck hitting anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025184754', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1628794951}
review:
Get the free version on Vlambeer's Itch.io.
The Steam release is full of bugs (not being able to shoot while strafing, clunky melee controls, broken achievements, and so on).
Since Vlambeer is no more, I guess they won't update/patch those issues.

Otherwise, it's a pretty fun and short Wolfenstein 3D/Doom clone of sorts with a pretty cool aesthetic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040005010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 491, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1629214379}
review:
ESPECTACULAR.
 Es un fps estilo Wolfeinstein 3d, pero con su propia identidad. 
 Posee pocos mapas, pero son algo laberinticos, no tanto como los fps clasicos, y son agradables de jugar.
 Tiene coleccionables, y al conseguirlos, desbloqueas tanto logros, como mapas bonus.
 Lo unico malo, que veo en este, es que:
 No tiene autoaim, como los fps clasicos.
  Apuntar es incomodo, aunque lo tengas de frente y le dispares, hay 60% de fallar.
  Sumandole que no puedes mover el mouse como se debe. Solo te puedes deslizar por los costados como en antaÃ±o.

 Aun asi, se le perdona.

 8/10 - Lindo para pasar el rato

review: no esta bueno: la sensibilidad esta tan alta que hacia me daba la vuelta queriendo doblar y no la podes cambiar, mientras disparas no podes mover la mira lo cual vuelve a la minigun obsoleta, la pistola se dispara tan rapido como vos puedas apretar el mouse asi que basicamente tenes 2 miniguns, conseguir tres estrellas en un mapa es absurdamente complicado, los mapas bonus no estan buenos y la I.A. es una mierda

author: {'steamid': '76561198039954128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1617910128}
review:
[h2]This game is running but broken in its current state. There is a steam guide for fixing it though.[/h2]

It is nice to see a port of this game to Steam available for free! 
It is unfortunately being held back by some small bugs that make certain points in the game kind of unplayable:

1. While holding down fire you cannot turn your camera. This is a little jarring on the first couple of weapons, but as soon as you get an automatic weapon it quickly proves to be unusable due to this bug.
2. If you hold down space bar your turning speed gets all smooth and accelerates in crazy speeds.
3. The game claims there are 52 collectibles but there are proven to be only 51. 


The first two issues are very problematic when the game expects the player to play at high speeds and with a lot of precision in order to get collectibles.

With the community fix the game is fully restored to being playable and feels pretty close to old FPS games similar to the original Wolfenstein. Although with much more cramped feeling levels.

The soundtrack is amusing but not something I would personally listen to for an extended amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050049656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1626403755}
review:
It's a decent little FPS title, it plays like a slightly slower version of Wolfenstein 3D, the levels are much much shorter and more linear than it in comparison and has less secrets. The guns feel pretty good, it has no difficulty spikes or is frustrating, it's just a basic but fun little Wolfenstein-lite game. I did enjoy going for all the achievements though, that's where most of my playtime came from. Getting the best times, all items and enemies to 100% each level and unlock bonus ones was neat.

 If you're super bored and need something simple I recommend this game however the steam version isn't very good, it has a very low resolution that you can't change, it has framerate issues, and you can't move your mouse while shooting unlike the Itch.io version so if you're gonna play this I recommend downloading the fan patch from the community hub or just playing the other version of the game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258016710', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1624923198}
review:
A short, but fun homage to 90s FPS with some challenging levels and a slapping soundtrack. The pixel art is cartoony, charming and full of life.

Although my one gripe is that the final boss is somewhat infuriating. It's impossible to predict where the helicopter will spawn, meaning that the amount of time it takes to beat is largely down to RNG and you may well get shot in the back while trying to locate it - something made difficult by the mono audio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035005176', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1624760035}
review:
GUN GODZ is a shooter inspired by the classics of the genre featuring Yung Venuz (a character that also appears in Nuclear Throne) and a solid rap soundtrack.  

I enjoyed my time playing this quite a lot, however, the mouse sensitivity and lack of options for control made my experience much harder than it should've probably been.  

I can't really complain about any of this since it's a free title, I'd recommend you try it if you have an hour or two to kill.

review:
Short but sweet little Wolfenstein 3D clone for free, beat in 40 minutes or so.
The fact that you can't steer your aim while shooting makes the chaingun a pain to use, but besides that, everything works fine and the action is what you expect from an old-school shooter. It's free, you can't go wrong with that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022520781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1621013531}
review:
GUN GODZ is a fun playthrough of a DOOM-like FPS mixed with a bit of twitch shooter, with the gameplay here being pretty basic. Once you get the game up and running in good shape (which you'll need to in most cases as the game has a lot of compatibility issues and glitches, please look up a fix for shanking at the very least) it's a fun little game. 

Playing through the game should only take you at tops an hour or so, and if you're a completionist and want to get all the triangles, that'll add another hour to three hours depending on your skill/patience. Some levels I found were very easy to get 3â–² while others were legit infuriating, mostly due to time restrictions (seriously, burn in hell 3-2). The soundtrack and SFX are simple but enjoyable in a good way too.

So,

PROS
+Fun and simple FPS gameplay like a twitchy DOOM
+Retro-style SFX and graphics hit the mark
+Clearing difficult levels feels great
+Related to Nuclear Throne which is ok emoji 100 emoji 100 emoji
+ YUNG VENUZ â–²
+Free! 

CONS
-Simple for better and for worse
-Compatibility issues for many 
-Need a fix to make the game more playable
-Frustrating time-limits
-Lack of options or customization

Overall, definitely an enjoyable game for the low, low price of free and an easy recommend. The positives definitely outweigh the negatives if you can get the game running properly and is a fun playthrough for the majority. Please look up a fix for at least the shank; it'll make your life a lot easier.

Ima see you GODZ out there. â–²

author: {'steamid': '76561198351056702', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1646246602}
review:
I really like GUN GODZ, but not this version, it is just abysmal and unplayable. 

It does have more features than the original release, i'll give them that, but at what cost. I have pretty much the same problems that everyone else mentioned, specifically the huge FOV and mouse sensitivity, it gets to the point where it straight up makes me feel nauseous at fullscreen. Some of these problems just leave me utterly confused on how they can even happen, i'm unsure if these are actual bugs or purposeful changes.


Look, just don't bother with this version and get the itch.io version instead, you'll get a WAY better experience with it.

https://vlambeer.itch.io/gun-godz

author: {'steamid': '76561198012473463', 'num_games_owned': 4077, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1611672511}
review:
[h1]Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36214917/]Curator Group for more reviews[/url][/h1]
GUN GODZ is a first-person shooter heavily inspired by classic games like Wolfenstein 3D and Doom. If youâ€™ve played either of those games, you know what to expect from GUN GODZ. It keeps true to the feel of Wolfenstein 3D, without any new mechanics and almost no modernization. This is occasionally to the point of being a problem, as the game fails to really differentiate itself, at least in a gameplay sense.

GUN GODZ has an almost identical combat system as Wolfenstein 3D. You get a handful of basic weapons, but you need to explore each level to find ammo for them. Being a recent game, the shooting controls are much more intuitive than the original keyboard-based control scheme. Itâ€™s a necessary improvement in this day and age, but outside of this, the game comes off like a fantastic batch of custom levels for Doom, rather than a truly new game. This is obviously by design, but it still makes the gameplay stale to me.

The only unique thing about GUN GODZ is the presentation and aesthetic. It features a unique hip-hop soundtrack that complements the visuals perfectly. It has an alien vibe while retaining enough catchiness to ensure that it doesnâ€™t get too weird for the average player. The visual design of the world is great, albeit relatively unvaried. There are only 5 or so different environments, although itâ€™s also a free game, so a lack of content isnâ€™t actually a deal breaker.

GUN GODZ could have been a lot better than it is. If the game had a price tag and a budget to match, I would have loved to see a more fleshed out world with a greater range of environments, weapons and enemies. As it stands, GUN GODZ is a fun way to spend an hour or so, but itâ€™s far from a must play shooter.

6/10
[quote]
Visit our [url=https://www.mmmreviews.com]website[/url] for more in-depth reviews and recommendations
[/quote]

review:
This game shows a lot of promise, but there are a lot of issues i encountered. 
i thought the mouse was too sensitive and found myself over aiming and missing shots because of it.
that and i often found myself pressing escape to view options and accidentally closing out of the game.
also, whenever you hold down or click the mouse you lose control of the mouse which makes aiming even harder, especially if i was using the pistol. also if you hold space and move the mouse you spin in circles really fast

author: {'steamid': '76561198859951213', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1609307662}
review:
[h1] El Wolfenstein de ositos [/h1]

Es bastante simple y va al grano. AtravesÃ¡s varios niveles, con rap de fondo, por diferentes zonas, con un par de jefes y listo. Es corto, solo son 3 zonas y no hay muchas armas. Si el juego te termina gustando hay unos cuantos niveles especiales y logros mÃ¡s. EstÃ¡ bueno para simplemente pasar el rato, nada mÃ¡s. Es entretenido y hasta frenÃ©tico en ciertos niveles

Algo que podrÃ­a criticar es su sistema de guardado, que solo guarda la partida cuando completÃ¡s una zona, es decir, solo guarda la partida cada 3 niveles. Y tambiÃ©n que no se puede poner pausa, si apretÃ¡s ESC vuelve al menÃº principal. TambiÃ©n que a veces inexplicablemente el juego va a cÃ¡mara lenta, pero bueno, dejando eso de lado estÃ¡ bien, es solo un juego que terminÃ¡s en unas horitas, incluso puede que menos. Ah, y es [b] gratis [/b]

Edit: Tengan cuidado con el volumen, varias veces me lastimÃ© el oÃ­do con los sonidos del juego.

[h1] Puntaje: 8/10 [/h1]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561199026388122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1608821148}
review:
Pretty tight

I would actually say it's better than Nuclear Throne, and I like that game a lot

It's a cross between Wolfenstein 3D and DOOM, made by the guys who made Nuclear Throne with an interesting and weird, funky bumping soundtrack, and, it's free. 
So, what's not to like?

I keep hitting ESC to pause, and it keeps shutting the game down, so that wasn't fun

QUIT BECAUSE: 
THAT RAT HOMUNCULUS BOSS IS IMPOSSIBLE TO BEAT
I did it a bunch of times, did two "perfect runs", and there just literally isn't enough anmo in the level to kill him
Kinda sucks, because I liked it, and was having fun, and wish I could keep going, but its whatever

author: {'steamid': '76561198046253819', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1608284895}
review:
Pros:
- music is neat

- sprite work is nice in some aspects

Cons:
- sound is [b]EXTREMELY LOUD[/b]. I have never played a louder game. You cannot hear the music, unless you want your ears to be blasted by the sound effects. There are no settings to adjust it. I had to play at 9 volume on my windows volume slider.

- No settings or pause menu: no sound settings, no difficulties, no way to change the controls, no pausing. no nothing.

- controls and/or shooting are awkward, due to strafing being forced on the mouse. no freelooking on this one, lads. (play the itch.io version for a non-strafing mouse. I have no idea how this was screwed up on the steam version.)

- Game is far too easy, and super short.


I know it sounds like I'm being hard on a free game, but it genuinely feels like this was just dumped with no attention. It lacks settings/features even the most basic doom WAD/fangame would. This is especially disappointing, after people supposedly had been waiting years for this to make it to steam, and this is what they get.

Pass on this one, or play the itch version.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970373892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1607272195}
review:
A fun little free WOLF3D like "retro" FPS game that lasts for around 30 minutes.

The controls and the shooting feels a bit wonky, but it's still worth the time and it's still fun enough to shoot some baddies popping up on the screen.

It feels like some heart were put into it and for a game that's completely free it's hard to complain about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104033148', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1589334084}
review:
DOOM, but on Venus. This game is the origin story for our favorite Eye of Providence, Yung Venuz, who is more commonly known from being playable in Nuclear Throne.

Pros:
+ Its DOOM (Shooting and fast walkspeed, why not?)
+ All 6 of the music tracks are good
+ You become a GUN GOD
+ Guns for fake necklace

Cons:
- Its DOOM (Game gets very repetitive, and doesn't have much substance to make you come back)
- Its very short
- You probably won't play this again after you beat it

TL;DR: Game is alright for a short little gimmick game, but you probably won't like it unless you're a Nuclear Throne fan.

review: The concept is good for a classic wolfenstein/doom style sprite based fps, but it needs work.  The game lacks the ability to adjust mouse sensitivity or adjust audio levels.  If you hit Esc twice the games exits.  Key remapping is abysmal, but there aren't that many keys to remap.  If those issues get fixed I would recommend this game.

review:
GUN GODZ es buen juego tiene una buena dificultad,buen sountrack,graficos nostalgicos que referencian de buena manera los inicios de doom y wolfestein y es muy bueno general.
las contras de este serian la intensa sensibilidad que tiene el cuchillo y el no poder mover la mira con la minigun pero siendo gratis no tiene ningun desperdicio el jugarlo

author: {'steamid': '76561198008282906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1575871548}
review:
Check out my Steam Curator page, "Minorthreatt Gaming Reviews." I have the most organized and extensive genre lists on Steam! Be sure to "FOLLOW" for more of my recommendations: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31339849-Minorthreatt-Gaming-Reviews/?appid=257170

The Short of it: FREE to play, fast, old school FPS with good soundtrack. Guns feel and sound great; they all have a heavy bang and kick to them. Been waiting for this to release for YEARS, but so glad I followed it. 

Reminds me of: If you liked DOOM, there's a good chance you'll like GUN GODZ.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996862422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1634237331}
review:
This is really kinda charming. The weapons feel great, the levels are well laid out, damage for each weapon per enemy is thought through. That and the music is bumpin'. The game let me flick and pace through levels at a rate surprisingly engaging, and I even died one or two times trying to do that having underestimated the challenge in the next room. All of this demonstrates implicit care that went into the production. The combination of all of these things made for a great shooter experience. I would be happy to purchase an extended version of this, as this makes for an excellent chapter 1 shareware demo!

The only criticism I have is that the game should do a better job of giving player affordances  to secrets. I found myself shooting at random walls and walking along corners of corridor just to find them. It isn't clear that there are any secrets to be found. There needs to be a mix between those which are difficult to find, and those which are marked as player guidance. The linearity of the game is a feature which I respect, but some players (like myself) are completionists rather than time-trailers - and secrets can cater for this without breaking from the linearity of the game by making the environments worth exploring.

But this is certainly forgivable as you have even went so far as to put in the effort to incorporate humour into the labyrinth. The game is almost everything the genre should be. If I were to describe the game in one word I would say it is considerate, and readers and fans of the genre alike would behove themselves not to try it.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198043693378', 'num_games_owned': 1424, 'num_reviews': 1430, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1585585229}
review:
I don't get why the reviews for this are so good. Yes, it's free and it's an old school shooter. Sounds good so far.
But I'll tell you now why I think this is a bad game:
-the musics are awful, I guess that's subjective, but I found it really horrible
-the mouse controls are spongy, aiming is quite hard with it
-the damage you deal is very inconsistent, like there are enemies which should die from a direct hit with the rocket launcher (seen in videos of the game), although I never acoomplished that, same with other weapons; the little enemies should die from one shot of the shotgun, though sometimes they survive it, even at close range
-the enemies hitboxes are too small, a lot of times I thought: "how did this shot miss, that's impossible!"
-the minigun enemy can sometimes hit you through the wall
-the minigun weapon sucks because for some reason if you are firing you can't turn the gun, which means you have to aim for an enemy, then fire till he is dead, then stop firing, aim for another enemy, etc. 
EDIT: Well, it seems this is the case with every weapon: when you hold the left mouse button, your aim is completely locked.
-there is one bugged achievement. Fortunately there is a fix in the steam guides. The dev doesn't seem to care for all the issues the game has.
-the game in general is way too hard, especially in the later levels, the game is throwing so many strong enemies at you AND you barely get ammo
-the way this game is meant to be played sucks: because the main goal is to get 3 "triangles" on every level (4 on some). You get them by getting in a level 100% kills, 100% items and by ending a level under a certain time (which is often really low) AND you have to do all of these simultaneously. (the 4th one you get from a collectible)
As if the game wouldn't be hard enough without that. 
Also why aren't they multiple difficulty settings?
Anyway the fact that you "have" to speedrun every level is just annoying and not fun at all.

STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME.
There is a similar game called "Intrude" which is just so much better, even though it is not free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134034000', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1584680833}
review:
Great doomlike FPS but the steam port is pretty bad: the shooting is absolutely fucked to the point where it's pretty unplayable. Get the free download online instead of the steam version, still rating positive because it's a great game. Nice simple gameplay, fluid controls and fun level design, all posing a difficulty without being frustrating because of how quick the levels are. Has a lot of speedrunning potential and a few secret collectables. 

Check it out but not through steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011668467', 'num_games_owned': 840, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1586466619}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995919341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1584660318}
review:
I'm genuinely confused by the reviews saying this is a bad/inferior port and to download the Itch.io version instead? The Itch version is much, much older (from 2013 to be exact) and far worse than this one on Steam, which appears to be newly remade in GameMaker Studio, the same engine as another Vlambeer game featuring a triangular firearm deity, Nuclear Throne. I've encountered no issues whatsoever with controls or aiming (I'm running Windows 10, 64 bit).

Here's the differences in the Steam version:
-You can now remap the controls (not possible in the Itch version)
-Better graphics (the Itch version's pixels are upscaled and blurry, since the game only runs in fullscreen)
-New/updated sound effects
-Respawn now functions correctly (on the Itch version when you die the game just gets stuck on you being dead and you need to press Esc to go back to the menu to continue playing)
-Probably has no issues running on any version of Windows given the change in engine (the Itch version was known to have problems running on Windows 8)
-Achievements

My only complaint is that the music is a lot quieter here compared to the Itch version, which is unfortunate given the music is basically the best part of the game. A volume slider would be a nice addition, but overall I'm just thrilled that Vlambeer finally updated and re-released this game, apparently going so far as to entirely remake it in another engine in order to do so. It's a short but very fun little Doom clone with a kickass soundtrack that gave us the breakout character of Yung Venuz. Thank you based Gun God! â—¬

author: {'steamid': '76561198062356811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1606337184}
review:
This game's mechanics have way more depth than you initially think, don't let the aesthetics fool you. It also balances pretty fairly between being challenging and being fun and has a moderate replay value. Weapons may lack reload or recoil, but this only indicates that your FPS skills will be challenged in new ways.

Edit: I almost forgot to praise Jukio Kallio's phenomenal work on the soundtrack. Also the "mouth" sound effects were very funny. Overall awesome work on the sound.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k7pZz0w9gqY

author: {'steamid': '76561197981584822', 'num_games_owned': 1438, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1579496586}
review: I was willing to pay for this game when I first saw it and after playing it I'm glad I didn't.  I usually enjoy titles like this.  Something to do to pass the time at work. This is just an underdeveloped project that needs more attention or needs a springboard title to follow that says "That was not my best work but here is something to show a culmination of efforts and things I learned."  The inability to control any of the control schema meant I was on a uber high sensitivity with no way to control it. The gunplay was simplistic, hit scan, and respectable. The monsters were interesting and the themes and music not bad.  This could have been so much more.  This could have been my new at work time killer title, my new 'waiting on people to get in a call together' title, my new 'I genuinely enjoy the things about this game' title. Instead it was something that I hope can be expounded upon later by development in some other vision.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212204533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1583258095}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001494272', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1582246625}
review:
This is a migraine in video game form. No options menu, so gun sounds are 5 times louder than the music and mouse sensitivity is locked. The controls imitate Doom with awkward mouse turning, but lacking enough auto aim. Feels terrible to play in general. Enemies are mostly hitscan gunners, so you will get chipped to death. Levels feel procedurally generated, and are absolutely terrible visually. 

We are in an era of retro-FPS love letters, with lots of talented indies fighting for attention. Vlambeer should do much better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058159844', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1579610583}
review:
Itâ€™s kind of weird, when you think about it, that the [i]Doom[/i] clone is back in fashion. The thing about [i]Doom[/i] is that while itâ€™s certainly a fun game, itâ€™s not actually famous or iconic for its excellent level design or excellent gameplay; [i]Doom[/i] was a huge technical achievement for its time, so why is it coming back now? If you believe in the 30-year cycle of nostalgia it kind of makes sense that we want to see the late â€˜80s and early â€˜90s reappearing in popular culture, but nostalgia just doesnâ€™t [i]work[/i] that way with games. This is why people always want to see their childhood favourites remade and re-released: because a lot of them just arenâ€™t very fun to play any more.

[i]Gun Godz[/i] makes no meaningful attempt to update or even really innovate on the [i]Doom[/i] formula. The big difference is that key hunting puzzles have been totally removed, so itâ€™s actually been boiled down to just the shooting, which sounds really good thanks to Vlambeerâ€™s signature excellence in sound design, but is totally butchered thanks to somebody having the genius idea of locking the first-person camera in place during the frame that youâ€™re firing. If I didnâ€™t understand the appeal of regressing to [i]Doom[/i] clones, I [i]especially[/i] donâ€™t understand why anyone would want to play [i]Gun Godz[/i], which is in many ways actually less pleasant to play than [i]Doom[/i] itself was, providing nothing but a nice soundtrack to compensate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085116796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1578958632}
review:
bad port of the game, get the itchio version instead.

the music is apparently playing in a library as the gunshots break the sound barrier, knife breaks the mouse sensitivity somehow, holding down the fire button disables your ability to look around (which makes the minigun pretty much useless), this was supposed to be ported in 2015 what did they even do to cause such a janky port?

author: {'steamid': '76561198246254490', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1593723488}
review:
This is simply another case of a "short but sweet" game. The game plays in a style similar to the original Doom, which can be a bit of a nostalgia trip. Although there are only 16 levels in the game (secret levels included), the levels take some time to master, so don't expect yourself to 3-triangle (or 4-triangle for certain levels) every level on your first playthrough. Overall, if you want to play a quick game without spending as much as a cent, try this game out.

P.S. Considering some of the issues the Steam port has, such as your view being locked when you fire, I'd recommend the itch.io version, which doesn't have those problems. Don't ask me why, because I don't know.

author: {'steamid': '76561199000289745', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1590541789}
review:
Do you need guns 
â€¢ that hate Texas?
â€¢ that make breakfast?
â€¢ that send texts? 

Pop-pop with your gun cocked, GUN GODZ is Wolfenstein 3D on enough of a stimulant cocktail to send most bass-boosters into a never-ending strobe-light seizure.

Ascend the path of maturity as measured through calibre, from the humble butterfly knife (that sends you into a coma-inducing lightspeed pirouette whenever you use it and move the camera: nobody within shanking distance is safe) to the grand bazooka. GUN GODZ is not a game that wastes your time with anything not capable of getting you on a Most Wanted list. 

You're a busy prisoner. You've got prisons to break out of. Shanks to carve out of toothbrushes and endless calisthenics drills to go through. GUN GODZ understands you. By the time you realise you're in one type of level, you're already on to the next. Let the rhythmic bass of endless violence carry you to the ledge of bullet nirvana.

If you're playing this right, and maybe you are, you're playing through it exactly once and then downloading the soundtrack immediately. Let the soundtrack guide you in this short, miserable life, let it make your financial decisions and career path choices. It will not fail you. 

[i]Did you know: Doseone did the rhymes? Also did some other cool soundtracks, worth checking out. [/i]

If you're trying to 100% GUN GODZ, for some reason, then getting all the triangles is enjoyable enough (the secret maps are a nice switch up) All levels are designed with pistol starts in mind, which is excellent. You're firmly in the Bullet Asphodel Meadows, not quite Bullet Nirvana but definitely not Bullet Purgatory. 

But you'll notice the aiming, especially from what I remember from the previous VENUZ release, is jank. Probably notice it the second you start. You especially feel it when they introduce flighty, flirty enemies that take little bullet kisses at you and then hop off to go be annoying in another 2 seconds time while you're shooting the wall next to them vehemently. 
A lot of those time challenges relied on just shooting stuff before it moved. It's a game I ended up playing in 5 minute bursts to stop my hand from seizing up, gets hectic.

[i]Pro Tip: Apparently you can hit 8 and 9 to adjust mouse sensitivity ingame. I didn't know that until afterwards, though.[/i]

And the 100% achievement is broken anyway. Outright, it requires you to have more triangles than the 52 that are in the game. A shame. Every single person who has that achievement at the moment cheated it in. [i]Including me.
I refuse to submit to rightful judgement, I earned that. This wasn't theft, it was more rival gang members gunning each other down after a triangle deal gone wrong. Grey territory at worst.[/i]

GUN GODZ: It wants your bulletz. Give them to it. Worth Gunning, worth Godding, and will forever change your approach to shooters - "But can I Gun God in it?".

author: {'steamid': '76561197995335681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1578640559}

Actually, here's the original https://vlambeer.itch.io/gun-godz

author: {'steamid': '76561198085988710', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1578270043}
review:
It's a great game, with an amazing soundtrack.
The enemies and the places are well designed along with the levels, and of course Yung Venuz.
Feels amazing to 100% and quite challenging at places, but after you complete it there isn't much to come back to besides casual mayhem.
Main gripe with the game is the camera, although it might be a problem in the original Wolfenstein and games from that era, you can quickly get disoriented if you move it too quickly, with time you'll get used to it.

Still a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025259797', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1578244909}
review:
I long anticipated this being released on steam due to being a fan of vlambeer's nuclear throne. I am left disappointed.

I enjoyed what I played of the game, but it made me feel [b]incredibly nauseous[/b] very fast. I cannot recommend the game on this basis. I've only ever felt this bad this quick once before when I played HL2.

I think it comes down to a few issues:

i] The incredibly high in-game sensitivity, with no way of changing it. Even after changing my G502's dpi to [i]minimum[/i] it was awful. My wrist took a lot of strain trying to wrestle with this to control the camera, even though I can normally play fps for hours just fine.

ii] no way to change FOV

iii] no way to toggle view-bobbing

iv] What I can only think is an attempt to put hit-stop/ impact-frames into an fps - every time you M1, your rotation is paused for about 1 frame. So if you try to track or flick aim while rapidly pressing M1 on your pistol [which doesn't have cooldown like your shotgun] your view is constantly pausing and skipping, inconsistently. Making aiming very hard, and painful to shoot every time.

Also annoyingly the key-rebinding doesn't list out all the controls, and silently skips keys you can't rebind e.g. primary fire M1, #1-9 gun swap, hold space for hyperturning??? what even is this.

I also had a temperamental bug when my character's gun model and knife were flashing between each other. Holding forward settled the focus on the gun, but stopping would restart the flashing. This made M1 only fire about 50% of the time while standing still. Some times on a level I'd have this, sometimes not.

I really enjoy the music and vocal performance of doseone. I like the colour aethetic and the sprites/ character designs.

I find the pixel-rendering a bit odd [but interesting] - the aliasing and jaggies are at a different "size" compared to the pixel-art.

edit: tried the itch.io release, much better and the hitstop is gone. the game is much easier and more fun, and a most of the nausea I quickly I felt is gone. but not completely eliminated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168589486', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1650820218}
review:
This is one of the best old school games I've ever played, I have some ideas so the game would be better (I'm not a hater I'm just giving you some ideas):

- The game needs more bosses: like seriously? 2 bosses? Quake had 4 bosses, 1 per stage, I think adding more bosses would be better and have longer and harder gameplay.

- More stages and bonus stages: With more stages, it would have more time of gameplay, it's just that the game is too short if you intended on doing a short game it's ok.

- The game needs better bonus stages: I have a question, did you guys took the bonus stages seriously? Putting a thousand enemies on the second bonus stage was a joke right? If you want to make bonus stages then make [b]GOOD[/b] bonus stages.

- The game needs more guns: 4 guns and 1 knife, I think it needs at least 2 more guns, here are two gun ideas: [u]1) A gun that fires lasers.[/u]
                              [u]2) A chainsaw (not to replace the knife).[/u]

- The game needs more enemies: following your enemy concept the enemies need to have the same guns as you do, if you're going to put more guns then make enemies with the guns I mentioned before.

This is my list of things that you can add on your game I'm not a hater I just want this game to be better :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198312153282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1577738459}
review:
Gun Godz is a... [i]playable[/i] Wolfenstein clone. The aim movement feels way too fast, and not comfortable to control. I believe this issue is tied to the uncapped framerate of the game.

Oh, and [b]you can't pause the game[/b] - if you press Esc, you go back to the title screen. How they didn't add such a basic functionality that every single player game should have is beyond me.

With some extra polish this would make a nice little $2-$3 game, but in its current state, this game deserves its current price: [b]Free[/b]

Try this game out if you really like FPS games, but I would recommend to just stick to playing Doom or Heretic WADs on GZDoom.

Also, check [b]Nuclear Throne[/b], a rogue-like top-down shooter by the same dev, which is a WAY better game:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/242680/Nuclear_Throne

author: {'steamid': '76561198018759231', 'num_games_owned': 3828, 'num_reviews': 512, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1577142091}
review:
GUN GODZ is a nice little free retro fps.
Pretty sure it's been in development hell or something happened which delayed the game as i first discovered this game like 3 or 4 years ago.

Pros:
+It's free.
+Visual style is cool.
+Nice and fun rap inspired music.
+Classic Doom/Wolf3D gun play is alright.
+Levels are not too long or too short.

Cons:
-30fps limited framerate.
-Some ennemies are really annoying hitscanners lol.
-I expected more from this game and would have paid for it if it had more content.

I recommend as i enjoyed playing it but don't expect anything too crazy or GOTY material.
It's free anyway, so not much to lose here.
Thanks Vlambeer for finally releasing it and for free lol.

Rating 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064119576', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1576174664}
review:
Literally unplayable garbage.
1. The game was supposed to be released by the end of 2018, but Vlambeer delayed the released by one year, only to make a Mac version of the game, which I don't think such a huge problem to tackle.
2. Besides the achievements, which are either broken or given after a short delay, the game is no different from itch.io release.
3. Can't remap the keybindings to mouse.
4. The game may not start in fullscreen (fixable with Alt+Enter).
5. No audio settings at all, miniguns sound like a dozen of buzzaxes put right next to your ear compared to other sounds in the game, and you can't do anything about it!
6. You can't rotate while firing a minigun, unlike in the original game.
An extra year of wait. Thanks, Rami.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972662821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1576166108}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067210408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1576100965}
review:
For a free game this is pretty good and worth your time but there are a few problems with it.
This is a wolfenstein clone but that isn't bad within itself, the problem comes from how slippery the mouse is with the game and it felt like the enemies were less of a threat than the mouse screwing you over but I got used to it.
The game is very short too but that is to be expected for a free game.
Overall you will like this game if you play first person shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098269594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1576081278}
review:
Wish somebody had told me that this game has been available for download for 6 years. 
Here I was waiting patiently, I had it followed and wishlisted only to be told that the freeware version is better.

In conclusion: Decently fun but pretty short game (took me 45 minutes), with the expected amazing venutian soundtrack.

Would definitely recommend if you have a spare hour or two

holy geez, i was witing this game.
i dont have any reclamation in this 0.5 hours that i played, so for now, only pros will be commented.

the detail that i liked thes most was the flash that the shot makes when it hits the enemy in the background, giving the player a chance to see what is coming or wht is there.

like Doom, i'm hoping the game became availble to play in a microwave

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1575996825}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

GUN GODZ is a game developed and published by Vlambeer

The game offers some really nice graphics and a nice yet simplistic aesthetic which is pleasant all the same and has some amazing attention to detail even though it is a little rough around the edges

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nonetheless and ends just at the right time

GUN GODZ overall, however, is an okay game to play, yet sometimes repetitive and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is an okay free-to-play action game to play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198318672654', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1583174761}
review:
I've waited for this game to be on Steam. And the game is really fun. The weapons are nice and punchy, you got a pretty good variety of enemies to shoot. Honestly what more could you want? There is one thing that bothered me. When you shoot it won't allow you to aim. it locks your mouse and if you move it while holding/pressing M1 it simply won't register or it just ignores the input. Many of my deaths were because of my inability to aim because of that glitch. But even still. I had a good time, and the game is free so I can't complain much.

(edit: pls put this game on Switch, I'll pay)

review:
There is a glitch where if you are holding left click at all you can't change where you're aiming, you can't change what direction you are firing at all, this glitch doesn't exist in the freeware version, ok.

Edit: Somebody said that if I'm referring to the minigun then this is intentional so let me respond to that real quick,
1: I'm referring to all weapons, even the pistol
2: It isn't intentional, in the original download version of the game you can move freely with the minigun. (The way a doom clone should be)

author: {'steamid': '76561198224522792', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1698096160}
review:
I had a lot of fun with it! Great soundtrack, good weapons that feel punchy (especially the shotgun that basically carried me through the game), overall pretty good.

There are just a few problems that should be addressed though:
Sensitivity is fixed, it would be great if you could change it. (Edit: Apparently this can be changed, but it's not a very obvious fix to the point where most people don't know how.)
The game was kinda short. Playing through all the main levels, not going for all the triangles, took me less than an hour.
You can't adjust your aim while shooting. On most weapons this isn't a problem as they are all single fire, but the fully auto minigun was a pain to use unless all your enemies were down a narrow corridor, so the minigun was most of the time just a quick burst fire weapon. Kinda defeats the point of a minigun.

That being said however, the game was still great fun to play regardless. Loved the soundtrack, the enemies, the challenge, and to top it all off, it's a free game!

Well done Vlambeer, would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071454198', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1575863958}
review:
I've had this game on my wishlist for a while now, so when I saw that it finally released, I gleefully downloaded the game and got to it.

The first thing I noticed about the game was that it's pretty damn loud, and with no setting to change the sound, it quickly became annoying. In fact, that was a major problem with the game -- no settings to speak of. You can change a few key binds and bam, that's it. The game is stuck to a high volume and high sensitivity, and you can't change it at all.

The guns present in the game feel powerful. They have punchy sound effects and just feel great. What didn't feel great though was the fact that you can't turn and shoot at the same time. As a result, the minigun is arguably the most frustrating weapon to handle. Whether or not this was intentionally, it needs to be fixed to allow for turning and shooting to be done in tandem. 

Enemy designs look nice in the style that the game presents itself in. They are also very distinct from one another, making it easy to see threats in a crowd of pushovers.

Musics matches the style of the game well, but it's hard to hear due to the loud firing sounds from both yourself and your enemies.

One final point to mention is the length. By the time you finish reading this review, you might have been able to complete the game. If you are only playing to get to the end, it'll take 30 minutes, tops. The game tries to address this by awarding triangles on each level based on kills, items, and speed. If you have enough triangles, you can play through some of the bonus levels. This sounds fine, except that some triangles are hidden in levels, behind false walls. Have fun with that. 

Overall, it's not necessarily a bad game, but it has too many glaring issues to be anything worth writing about. The presentation is on point, but the game drops the ball in several key areas.  You can spend a night playing through it, and maybe try going for triangles, but for me, this game is a one-and-done. Play it once, never touch it again.
